hypothesis_content.title: Holiday Lull Reversal - Post-Christmas Liquidity Return
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes with low holiday volume, a 3+ day consolidation below the 20-day VWAP followed by a return above it with expanding volume (>30% above 10-day average) signals a 48-hour momentum move in the direction of the breakout.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Holiday periods create artificial liquidity vacuums where price action is distorted. Institutional return post-holiday creates predictable directional flows as pent-up orders execute. Current news mentions 'holiday lull' and ETF outflows creating this exact setup.
entry_conditions: BTC 3-day price range < 2.5% of current price
Daily volume < 70% of 20-day average for 3 consecutive days
Price closes above 20-day VWAP with volume >130% of 10-day average

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5.2% gain from entry or 48 hours, whichever comes first

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain >24 hours or volume expansion proves temporary (<2 days). More than 40% of such signals result in immediate reversal to pre-breakout range.
